feed.title: Update: Unapologetic Chris Brown Tells Haters to 'F*ck Off'
feed.subtitle: A pile of famous folks took to Twitter to voice their disgust with the Grammys' Chris Brown love-fest, and Brown responded by telling them to "f*ck off."

entry.title: Update: Unapologetic Chris Brown Tells Haters to 'F*ck Off'

link.title: Rihanna and Chris Brown Ignore Each Other at L.A. Nightclub

content.div:
Three years after he attacked singer/girlfriend Rihanna following Clive Davis' pre-Grammy bash (for which he pleaded guilty to felony assault), the music industry welcomed Chris Brown back with open arms on Sunday night, awarding him Best R&B Album and letting him perform not once, but twice.

Still, the music world's collective amnesia wasn't embraced by everyone. During the show, #womanbeater became a trending Twitter topic (which Brown fans countered with a disturbing meme about how they wish he'd "beat them up").

Meanwhile, a pile of famous folks took to Twitter to voice their disgust of Grammy's Brown lovefest. Brown didn't take well to the criticism, tweeting on Tuesday, "HATE ALL U WANT BECUZ I GOT A GRAMMY Now! That's the ultimate FUCK OFF!" He, or possibly someone from his camp, deleted the tweet (but not before it could be screencapped) and replaced it with a less offensive (but still shockingly smug) post that read: "IM BACK SO WATCH MY BaCK as I walk away from all this negativity #teambreezygrammy."

Check out a selection of celebrity reactions to Brown's Grammy appearance below and let us know what you think in the comments section.

Are Chris brown's mom and dad CBS and Grammy Brown?

— Eric Stonestreet (@ericstonestreet) February 13, 2012


Chris Brown sucks

— Adam Scott (@mradamscott) February 13, 2012


How dang long did they give Nicki Minaj to do whatever that was? Strange. And Chris Brown twice? I don't get it. He beat on a girl...

— Miranda Lambert (@Miranda_Lambert) February 13, 2012


Not cool that we act like that didn't happen. He needs to listen to Gunpowder and lead and be put back in his place. Not at the Grammys.

— Miranda Lambert (@Miranda_Lambert) February 13, 2012


if Chris Brown had worn a wife beater, the irony would eclipse the whole show.#chrisbrownbeatswomen

— jack osbourne (@MrJackO) February 13, 2012


I'm not gonna mention that Chris Brown is a lady beater. Instead... Lip syncing? Come on, Chris. #grammys

— Horatio Sanz (@MrHoratioSanz) February 13, 2012


Wait... so Whitney's tribute, while incredibly moving, was one song... and Chris Brown got TWO performances...?

— Brooklyn Decker (@BrooklynDecker) February 13, 2012


And the rehabilitation of Chris Brown is now complete!!

— Bette Midler (@BetteMidler) February 13, 2012


Looks like all is forgiven w Chris Brown.That's all I'll say

— Sherri Shepherd (@SherriEShepherd) February 13, 2012


He's got a bodyguard? RT @EthanSuplee: Why wasn't @ChrisBrown fired from "music" (public dancing) when he beat up that girl?

— danny masterson (@dannymasterson) February 13, 2012


Hey why don't you take THIS moment to apologize? #ChrisBrown

— Le Tigre (@letigreworld) February 13, 2012


Trying not to go off on a rant but...Chris Brown...*bites tongue* have we forgiven him? #Grammys

— Michelle Branch (@michellebranch) February 13, 2012


Wait, did everyone forget that Chris Brown beat up Rhianna?#Worthrepeating #GRAMMYS

— st vincent (@st_vincent) February 13, 2012


Everyone who apparently forgot what Chris Brown did to Rhianna should read the police report on exactly what he did: goo.gl/VJQ0c

— Wil Wheaton (@wilw) February 14, 2012

jenm@dose.ca

entry.title: 2012 Grammy Awards - Best and Worst Moments

link.Abstract: It's music's biggest -- and longest -- night. Adele, Foo Fighters, Whitney Houston and more made for some of the most memorable moments of the 54th Annual Grammy Awards.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
As music's biggest night, the Grammys' mantra has always been about paying tribute to music's biggest stars. Typically, though, they're in the audience -- collecting more trophies than their Versace-clad arms can carry. That was certainly true of Sunday's edition -- with the likes of Adele, Kanye West and the Foo Fighters being lauded. But there was a heavy note to this year's show, broadcast the day after Whitney Houston's passing. The six-time Grammy winner was remembered throughout the evening, but that didn't stop the 54th Annual Grammy Awards from being the marathon, three and a half hour party it always is. Check out some of the highlights.
--Leah Collins/Dose.ca
link.title: As music's biggest night, the Grammys' mantra has always been about paying tribute to music's biggest stars. But there was a heavy note to this year's show, broadcast the day after Whitney Houston's passing. The six-time Grammy winner was remembered throughout the evenin
